        this object to allow chaining
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - - if no IP address for the host could be found, or if a scope_id was specified for a global IPv6 address.

      • setTimeOutMillis

        public PortScan setTimeOutMillis(int timeOutMillis)
        Sets the timeout for each port scanned

        If you raise the timeout you may want to consider increasing the thread count setNoThreads(int) to compensate. We can afford to have quite a high thread count as most of the time the thread is just sitting idle and waiting for the socket to timeout.

        Parameters:
        timeOutMillis - - the timeout for each ping in milliseconds Recommendations: Local host: 20 - 500 ms - can be very fast as request doesn't need to go over network Local network 500 - 2500 ms Remote Scan 2500+ ms
        Returns:
        this object to allow chaining

        Returns:

      • setPorts

        public PortScan setPorts(java.lang.String portString)
        Scan the ports to scan
        Parameters:
        portString - - the ports to scan (comma separated, hyphen denotes a range). For example: "21-23,25,45,53,80"
        Returns:

      • setNoThreads

        public PortScan setNoThreads(int noThreads)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Parameters:
        noThreads - set the number of threads to work with, note we default to a large number as these requests are network heavy not cpu heavy.
        Returns:
        self
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - if no threads is less than 1

      • doScan

        public PortScan doScan(PortScan.PortListener portListener)
        Perform an asynchronous (non-blocking) port scan
        Parameters:
        portListener - - the listener to fire portscan results to.
        Returns:
        - this object so we can cancel the scan if needed
